What You Will Do:
Design and prototype models based on statistical modeling, machine learning, and data mining in order to solve challenging analytics problems ranging from exploratory to highly applied
Manipulate, transform, and analyze abstract data structures
Select and apply the most appropriate modeling techniques and data visualization for big data analysis
Develop code to implement analysis workflows in a robust and reproducible fashion
Assist with high-level analysis, design, and code reviews
Basic Qualifications:
Master in Statistics, Data Science, Math, Computer Science, Computational Statistics or other related quantitative discipline

Job Description
Job Title: Data Scientist
Location: Bellevue & Los Angeles
Visa : GC & US Citizen
Skills:
SQL
Python/R



Show More

Apollo Neuroscience is pioneering new ways to empower people to live healthier lives by addressing the root of stress and anxiety: the nervous system. Balancing and calming the nervous system is essential to building resilience to stress. Originating from research in neuroscience and psychiatry at the University of Pittsburgh, Apollo Neuro, our debut product, is the first scientifically validated technology to improve the body’s resilience to stress. Unlike most other wearables, ours is not a biometric tracker; it is a wearable therapeutic that uses vibration to support the body’s recovery from stress.
We launched in January 2020 and have since grown to about 50 employees, raised our Series A, and completed six clinical trials. We’re now looking to make further investments in product development across software and hardware to build a premium experience that is even more intuitive and delightful to use.
Our company culture is built on a deep and genuine commitment to improving access to mental health. We’re a growing start-up, and empathy is our most important shared value. From that, we foster kindness and inclusion to create a respectful and friendly working environment. Our departments function collaboratively and intimately to build rapport and support individuals. We’re an entirely remote team, distributed worldwide with roots in Pittsburgh and the Bay Area.






Show More

This is a new role within the R&D organization. The Data Scientist will be
responsible for working with the company stakeholders to analyze the existing data that is being collected, build out a roadmap of potential ideas where could utilize the data, and develop an overall data mining strategy. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. Currently data is in an unstructured format and it will be up to the Data Scientist to determine the best way forward in utilizing the data.
Responsibilities
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for
leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
